data.title: Brace Sproul | Applied AI Engineer
data.snippet:
# BRACE SPROUL

HEAD OF APPLIED AI @ LANGCHAIN

AI/ML Engineer heading LangChain's Applied AI team. Interested in agents, drones, and rockets.

## EXPERIENCE

San Francisco

Head of Applied AI

March 2025 - Present

Applied AI Engineer

October 2023 - March 2025

San Francisco

Tech Lead | Full Stack Engineer

October 2022 - October 2023

Core team member developing Create's code generation AI agent using OpenAI's GPT via LangChain.

Working across a full TypeScript stack, building various features and products, including code generation using LLMs, infrastructure and database architecture, along with web apps.

### Linear IO Services

Remote

Full Stack Engineer Contract

September 2022 - January 2023 [...] September 2022 - January 2023

As a contract software engineer, I worked on small-medium sized projects for a range of clients, using a full-stack approach with technologies including TypeScript, GraphQL, PostgreSQL and Firebase to deliver high-quality solutions, services and applications.

### 510 Kickz LLC

Berkeley CA

Founder

July 2017 - September 2021

Founded a bulk aftermarket distribution company that specialized in footwear and apparel. Over $1M in lifetime sales with hundreds enterprise scale businesses, and direct to consumer.

## OPEN SOURCE

### LIBRARIES I'M A CORE MAINTAINER OF

### LangChain.js

Build context-aware reasoning applications. A TypeScript framework with millions of monthly downloads.

### LangGraph.js [...] ### LangGraph.js

Framework to build resilient language agents as graphs. The TypeScript implementation of LangGraph.

### FULLSTACK AI APPS/AGENTS

### Open Canvas

A better UX for chat, writing content, and coding with LLMs.

### Agent Inbox

An inbox UX for interacting with human-in-the-loop agents.

### Agent Chat UI

Web app for interacting with any LangGraph agent (PY & TS) via a chat interface.

### Social Media Agent

An agent for sourcing, curating, and scheduling social media posts with human-in-the-loop.

### MORE OPEN SOURCE PROJECTS

Check out my curated list of awesome LangGraph.js projects, tutorials, and resources. This repository contains a full list of open source AI projects, YouTube videos, and other resources for learning about and building with LangGraph.js.

data.title: How LangChain Found a Trusted Partner for Their Sandbox Needs
data.snippet:
As a leader in open‚Äësource agent development, LangChain‚Äôs bread and butter is building, orchestrating, and deploying agents seamlessly for developers and non‚Äëtechnical users alike. To advance this mission, Brace Sproul, Head of Applied AI, and his team built a cloud‚Äëhosted coding agent that runs autonomously end to end. To open-source it reliably, they needed to nail one thing: their sandbox partner. [...] Thanks to this reliable setup, LangChain allocates engineering hours and internal resources to the tasks that matter most: enhancing LangChain‚Äôs tools and libraries to facilitate agent testing, evals, and deployment. Because Brace and his team also configure details like CPU, RAM, and disk size limits, they optimize resource utilization without impacting performance or scalability.

These technical specs check every box on LangChain‚Äôs list. But what truly impressed Brace was Daytona's responsive assistance. As their cloud runtime platform hums in the background, their team stays hands-on through regular check-ins and swift online support. [...] And the team doesn‚Äôt stop at attentive support. They continuously evolve the platform based on LangChain‚Äôs feedback. By actively seeking input and implementing improvements quickly, Daytona keeps LangChain focused on their core projects and pushes them further ahead in the fast-moving AI space.

#### The fact that Daytona is always so engaged and responsive is one of the main reasons why we chose them. Working with them has been seamless.

Brace Sproul

Head of Applied AI at LangChain

###### 03 -- RESULT

### LangChain Spins Up 4000 Sandboxes Every Month with Daytona

data.title: Agent Builder Updates Automatically | Brace Sproul posted on the ...
data.snippet:
Agree & Join LinkedIn

By clicking Continue to join or sign in, you agree to LinkedIn‚Äôs User Agreement, Privacy Policy, and Cookie Policy.

# Agent Builder Updates Automatically

View profile for Brace Sproul

More Agent Builder details!
One of its most useful features is the ability to update itself on the fly. This means your agent can update its tools, prompt, subagents and skills mid session without you having to do any manual work.
Want it to have different tools? Just tell it to add them!
Want it to add a new skill/subagent? Ask it!
Anything you can do manually to update your agent, it can do on its own

View organization page for LangChain

485,775 followers [...] 3. Memory is built in
Each agent built comes equipped with memory, allowing it update itself based on user interactions. Since it is just represented as a set of files - updating its memory is just writing to (specific) files in the filesystem
4. Triggers let them act autonomously
In order to have agents truly work for you, you probably want to have them running in the background. Triggers let them be "ambient agents", acting on events in the background
5. Supervise agents in the feed
Just because agents are running in the background, doesn't mean you don't want to interact with them. The feed lets you monitor what agents are doing, approve sensitive actions, and answer questions they have
6. Comes with skills, MCPs, and subagents [...] 3. Memory is built in
Each agent built comes equipped with memory, allowing it update itself based on user interactions. Since it is just represented as a set of files - updating its memory is just writing to (specific) files in the filesystem
4. Triggers let them act autonomously
In order to have agents truly work for you, you probably want to have them running in the background. Triggers let them be "ambient agents", acting on events in the background
5. Supervise agents in the feed
Just because agents are running in the background, doesn't mean you don't want to interact with them. The feed lets you monitor what agents are doing, approve sensitive actions, and answer questions they have
6. Comes with skills, MCPs, and subagents

data.title: Introducing LangSmith's No Code Agent Builder - LangChain Blog
data.snippet:
LangChain Blog
Introducing LangSmith‚Äôs No Code Agent Builder

# Introducing LangSmith‚Äôs No Code Agent Builder

By Brace Sproul and Sam Crowder

Today, we‚Äôre expanding who can build agents beyond developers. While a lot of the highest volume, customer-facing agents will be built by technical teams, nearly every business user has use cases for agentic applications in their daily routines. Our new LangSmith Agent Builder provides a no code agent-building experience ‚Äî complete with memory and guided prompt creation ‚Äî that lowers the barrier to building agents.

Try Agent Builder today, and learn more about our approach below.

## What‚Äôs different

data.title: LangChain overview - Docs by LangChain
data.snippet:
LangChain is the easiest way to start building agents and applications powered by LLMs. With under 10 lines of code, you can connect to OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, and more. LangChain provides a pre-built agent architecture and model integrations to help you get started quickly and seamlessly incorporate LLMs into your agents and applications.We recommend you use LangChain if you want to quickly build agents and autonomous applications. Use LangGraph, our low-level agent orchestration framework and runtime, when you have more advanced needs that require a combination of deterministic and agentic workflows, heavy customization, and carefully controlled latency.LangChain agents are built on top of LangGraph in order to provide durable execution, streaming, human-in-the-loop, persistence, and [...] Standard model interface ------------------------ Different providers have unique APIs for interacting with models, including the format of responses. LangChain standardizes how you interact with models so that you can seamlessly swap providers and avoid lock-in. Learn moreEasy to use, highly flexible agent ---------------------------------- LangChain‚Äôs agent abstraction is designed to be easy to get started with, letting you build a simple agent in under 10 lines of code. But it also provides enough flexibility to allow you to do all the context engineering your heart desires. Learn moreBuilt on top of LangGraph ------------------------- LangChain‚Äôs agents are built on top of LangGraph. This allows us to take advantage of LangGraph‚Äôs durable execution, human-in-the-loop support, [...] ##### Agent development

   LangSmith Studio
   Test
   Agent Chat UI

##### Deploy with LangSmith

   Deployment
   Observability

On this page
   Create an agent
   Core benefits

LangChain overview

Copy page

LangChain is an open source framework with a pre-built agent architecture and integrations for any model or tool ‚Äî so you can build agents that adapt as fast as the ecosystem evolves
